intro: Mallotus havilandii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to yellow. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky shores or in dry, sunny environments. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is a symbol of Hawaii's unique flora.
